summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, provides a historical record detailing the activities and associations of Lindsey LING and Theodor HEINER during the late 1950s and early 1960s. It highlights LING's management of a Chinese restaurant in Madrid, Spain, and his intentions to establish another in Bermuda, alongside his interactions with Cuban nationals in Santa Maria, the Azores. The document also recounts HEINER's arrest for suspected espionage in the Azores and his subsequent presence in Bermuda, suggesting potential espionage connections to Cuban nationals and the Castro revolution.
key_findings: Lindsey LING was contacted by Cuban nationals in Santa Maria, the Azores, in late August 1960.
LING managed a Chinese restaurant in Madrid, Spain, and was planning to open another in Bermuda.
Theodor HEINER was arrested on suspicion of espionage in the Azores in December 1953 and was reportedly in Bermuda by September 1960.
The document suggests possible espionage activities linked to Cuban nationals and the Castro revolution.
